title: Volunteers find at least 44 BODIES buried in mass graves near a Mexican resort town
text:
A volunteer group searching for missing loved ones killed by gang violence has discovered at least 44 bodies in mass grave pits outside a northwestern Mexican resort town.

The team first found 13 bodies when searching near of Puerto Peñasco last week.

But the number of bodies dramatically rose over the weekend, as the volunteers, known as 'Madres Buscadoras de Sonora', or Searching Mothers of Sonora, found a further 31 bodies.

On Sunday, the group received a visit from Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, who has vowed to provide resources to help families find thousands of Mexicans reported missing.

Volunteer group searching for missing persons have discovered discovered at least 44 bodies since last Thursday in the western Mexico resort town of Puerto Peñasco

The prosecutor for the state of Sonora said two of the bodies were probably women

'Today we talked with @lopezobrador_ and asked for support for searches, body recognition and security [while] tracking. Hopefully it helps us,' the group said on its Twitter account.

According to ABC affiliate KNXV, a volunteer said the search would momentarily stop because funeral homes in Puerto Peñasco were full and there was no room for more bodies.

Prosecutors in the northern border state of Sonora said last Thursday that only one of the bodies was relatively recent. The others were 'complete skeletons with clothing.'

Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador met Sunday with a team of volunteer searchers made up of relatives of missing people who investigate reports of clandestine burial sites. The group discovered at least 44 bodies since last Thursday

Searching Mothers of Sonora, a group is made up of relatives of missing people who investigate reports of clandestine burial sites, discovered 13 bodies in five different pits last Thursday and an additional 31 bodies over the weekend

At least two of the bodies may be women. Tests are being conducted to determine gender and identity of the victims.

The volunteer search group is made up of relatives of missing people who investigate reports of clandestine burial sites.

Because of deficient police investigations, such volunteer groups have been responsible for discovering mass graves and burial pits in many parts of Mexico.

Most of the skeletons that were found in the secret pits were fully clothed, according to the Sonora state prosecutor

The resort town of Puerto Peñasco is located south of the Arizona border on the Gulf of California

Volunteer searchers made the gruesome discovery of at least 44 bodies since last week near the resort town of Puerto Peñasco, which is located on the Gulf of California

Drug and kidnapping gangs use such pits to dispose of the bodies of victims or rivals.

Puerto Peñasco is also known as Rocky Point. It is located south of the Arizona border and off the Gulf of California, also known as the Sea of Cortéz.

While not as violent as some other parts of Mexico, Puerto Peñasco has been known for Sinaloa drug cartel activity and a large-scale shootout between cartel gunmen and military forces occurred there in 2013.

The volunteer search group said it 'talked with @lopezobrador_ and asked for support for searches, body recognition and security [while] tracking. Hopefully it helps us'

Mexican authorities and researchers mill around a desert area near Puerto Peñasco, where at least 44 bodies were secretly buried
description: Searching Mothers of Sonora, a volunteer group,  have discovered 44 bodies in grave pits in the western Mexico resort town of Puerto Peñasco.
